The claim states that longstanding whist: 2. President Donald Trump and House Republican Leader Kevin McCarthy both tweeted about the changing of the rules just before the submission of the report, implying that it was a suspicious action.
Rudy Giuliani: Trump's lawyer, also echoed the claim that the Inspector General of the Intelligence Community secretly removed the requirement for first-hand knowledge from the complaint form.
An article published on September 27: 2019, alleged that the intelligence community eliminated the requirement for first-hand knowledge of alleged wrongdoings between May 2018 and August 2019.
